description: Ollama prompts for extracting RF component specifications from datasheets

cable.system_prompt: You are an expert RF engineer analyzing coaxial cable datasheets. Extract technical specifications and return ONLY valid JSON with no additional commentary.
extraction_hints: Look for attenuation tables (dB/100ft or dB/100m)
Power rating often in charts vs frequency
Velocity factor usually in electrical characteristics
Convert metric to imperial if needed (1m = 3.28ft, 1cm = 0.394in)

transmitter.system_prompt: You are an expert broadcast engineer analyzing transmitter datasheets. Extract technical specifications and return ONLY valid JSON with no additional commentary.
transmitter.user_prompt:
Analyze this transmitter datasheet and extract specifications. Return ONLY a JSON object:

{
  "component_type": "transmitter",
  "manufacturer": "<manufacturer>",
  "model": "<model number>",
  "part_number": "<part number>",
  "description": "<type of transmitter, power level, technology>",
  "frequency_range_mhz": [<min>, <max>],
  "power_output_watts": <rated output power>,
  "power_output_dbm": <calculated: 10*log10(watts*1000)>,
  "power_output_dbw": <calculated: 10*log10(watts)>,
  "efficiency_percent": <efficiency if listed>,
  "mains_voltage": "<voltage and phase, e.g. 230VAC or 400VAC 3-phase>",
  "power_consumption_watts": <AC power draw>,
  "output_impedance_ohms": <usually 50>,
  "connector_type": "<output connector type>",
  "harmonic_suppression_dbc": <-dB below carrier>,
  "spurious_suppression_dbc": <-dB below carrier>,
  "audio_input": ["<input 1>", "<input 2>"],
  "datasheet_url": "<URL if found>",
  "common_uses": ["<use cases>"],
  "notes": "<special features, modular design, etc>"
}

Calculate dBm = 10*log10(watts*1000), dBW = 10*log10(watts). Use null for missing fields.
extraction_hints: Harmonic suppression in RF output specs
Audio inputs in block diagram or I/O section

antenna.system_prompt: You are an expert antenna engineer analyzing antenna datasheets. Extract specifications and return ONLY valid JSON.
antenna.user_prompt:
Analyze this antenna datasheet and extract specifications. Return ONLY JSON:

{
  "component_type": "antenna",
  "manufacturer": "<manufacturer>",
  "model": "<model>",
  "part_number": "<part number>",
  "description": "<antenna type, elements, polarization>",
  "gain_dbi": <gain in dBi>,
  "gain_relative_dipole": <numeric gain relative to dipole, if listed>,
  "frequency_range_mhz": [<min>, <max>],
  "polarization": "<vertical/horizontal/circular>",
  "vswr": <maximum VSWR>,
  "impedance_ohms": <usually 50>,
  "connector_type": "<connector type>",
  "power_rating_watts": <max power>,
  "wind_survival_mph": <wind speed rating>,
  "pattern": "<omni-directional/directional>",
  "azimuth_pattern": "<omni/custom/etc>",
  "datasheet_url": "<URL>",
  "common_uses": ["<uses>"],
  "notes": "<mounting, construction, special features>"
}

For broadcast antennas, gain_relative_dipole is common. Convert if needed: dBd = dBi - 2.15
extraction_hints: Gain might be in dBi or dBd (dBd = dBi - 2.15)
Broadcast antennas often specify EIA flange connectors

lightning_arrestor.system_prompt: You are an expert RF protection engineer analyzing lightning arrestor datasheets. Extract specs and return ONLY valid JSON.
lightning_arrestor.user_prompt:
Analyze this lightning arrestor/surge protector datasheet. Return ONLY JSON:

{
  "component_type": "lightning_arrestor",
  "manufacturer": "<manufacturer>",
  "model": "<model>",
  "part_number": "<part number>",
  "description": "<type, mounting style, DC pass/block>",
  "insertion_loss_db": <typical insertion loss>,
  "frequency_range_mhz": [<min>, <max>],
  "connector_type": "<input/output connectors>",
  "voltage_rating_kv": <surge voltage rating in kV>,
  "dc_pass": <true/false>,
  "power_rating_watts": <if applicable>,
  "datasheet_url": "<URL>",
  "common_uses": ["<uses>"],
  "notes": "<DC pass, bulkhead mount, gas tube vs MOV, etc>"
}

Note if DC pass/block, connector types, and mounting style (bulkhead, inline, DIN rail).
extraction_hints: Surge voltage rating in protection specs
Check for DC pass or DC block

isolator.system_prompt: You are an expert RF engineer analyzing isolator/circulator datasheets. Extract specs and return ONLY valid JSON.
isolator.user_prompt:
Analyze this isolator or circulator datasheet. Return ONLY JSON:

{
  "component_type": "isolator",
  "manufacturer": "<manufacturer>",
  "model": "<model>",
  "part_number": "<part number>",
  "description": "<type, frequency band, power>",
  "insertion_loss_db": <forward loss>,
  "isolation_db": <reverse isolation>,
  "frequency_range_mhz": [<min>, <max>],
  "power_rating_watts": <average power>,
  "connector_type": "<connector type>",
  "vswr": <max VSWR>,
  "datasheet_url": "<URL>",
  "common_uses": ["<uses>"],
  "notes": "<3-port circulator vs 2-port isolator, etc>"
}

Isolation is the key spec - how much reverse protection.
extraction_hints: Power rating (average and peak if listed)

combiner.system_prompt: You are an expert RF engineer analyzing combiner datasheets. Extract specs and return ONLY valid JSON.
combiner.user_prompt:
Analyze this combiner datasheet. Return ONLY JSON:

{
  "component_type": "combiner",
  "manufacturer": "<manufacturer>",
  "model": "<model>",
  "part_number": "<part number>",
  "description": "<type of combiner, number of ports>",
  "insertion_loss_db": <typical insertion loss>,
  "isolation_db": <port-to-port isolation>,
  "frequency_range_mhz": [<min>, <max>],
  "power_rating_watts": <max power per port>,
  "number_of_ports": <number of input ports>,
  "connector_type": "<connector type>",
  "datasheet_url": "<URL>",
  "common_uses": ["<uses>"],
  "notes": "<cavity design, field tunable, etc>"
}

Note if cavity, notch filter, or hybrid design. Isolation between ports is critical.

filter.system_prompt: You are an expert RF engineer analyzing filter datasheets. Extract specs and return ONLY valid JSON.
filter.user_prompt:
Analyze this RF filter datasheet. Return ONLY JSON:

{
  "component_type": "filter",
  "manufacturer": "<manufacturer>",
  "model": "<model>",
  "part_number": "<part number>",
  "description": "<filter type: bandpass/notch/cavity/harmonic>",
  "insertion_loss_db": <loss in passband>,
  "rejection_db": <attenuation in stopband>,
  "passband_mhz": [<min>, <max>],
  "stopband_mhz": [<stop1_min>, <stop1_max>, <stop2_min>, <stop2_max>],
  "power_rating_watts": <max power>,
  "connector_type": "<connector type>",
  "datasheet_url": "<URL>",
  "common_uses": ["<uses>"],
  "notes": "<tunable, cavity design, etc>"
}

Specify passband (frequencies that pass) and stopband (frequencies rejected).

generic.system_prompt: You are an expert RF engineer analyzing component datasheets. Extract all relevant specifications and return ONLY valid JSON.
generic.user_prompt:
Analyze this RF component datasheet and extract all relevant specifications. Determine the component type (cable, transmitter, antenna, isolator, combiner, filter, connector, lightning_arrestor, etc.) and return appropriate fields in JSON format.

Return ONLY a JSON object with at minimum:
{
  "component_type": "<type>",
  "manufacturer": "<manufacturer>",
  "model": "<model>",
  "part_number": "<part number>",
  "description": "<description>",
  "datasheet_url": "<URL if found>",
  "frequency_range_mhz": [<min>, <max>],
  ...<additional relevant fields based on component type>
}

Include all technical specifications you can find. Use null for missing values.

antenna: gain_dbi typically -3 to +20 for most antennas
